originalText.text: Seckin Endometriosis Center has changed my life. After years of being rejected by doctors and struggling for someone to believe in my pain enough to operate on me (many said I was too young to have endometriosis or severe pain), I finally came across this clinic. Not only did Dr. Chu hear me out, but she validated my pain and experiences from our very first conversation. I knew I had to fly in to NYC to meet with her and follow through with the procedure right away. Throughout the entire process everyone was so kind and I truly felt cared for (office staff, assistants, surgeons, anesthesiologist, nurses, hospital staff). I couldn't have possible asked for a better experience. And despite the fact that all of my imaging had come back clear--Dr. Chu discovered Stage ll endometriosis during my excision operation. It has been nearly 3 months since this all happened and there are days where I'm still in disbelief that I was lucky enough to have encountered this amazing doctor and her amazing staff. So far I am already feeling so much better and my pain has significantly decreased. It's surreal. I am so grateful to have gone here, words cannot possibly do it justice.

originalText.text: After discovering Dr. Seckin’s book “The Doctor Will See You Now”, I knew he was the person I needed to see. As most endo warriors know, finding validation for your pain can be extremely difficult, to say the least. That is not the case with Dr. Seckin and his team. I had my initial consult with Dr. Chu and it was the first time in 17 years that I felt heard and acknowledged. I left the appointment knowing that there was someone who cared about my pain and wanted to help. Just over a month ago I made the trip out to New York for excision surgery. Firstly, I want to comment on the team’s bedside manners. Arriving at the clinic, i was having severe anxiety about the internal ultrasound due to the extreme pain i knew it would bring. Claire, one of the nurses, immediately noticed the anxiety i was having and calmly talked to me about it. I cannot remember her name, but one of the office workers actually came in to calm me down and hold my hand through the ultrasound. Dr Seckin, who performed the ultrasound, was so gentle and kind, walking me through the entire process. I have never experienced such care and understanding and it’s something i will never forget. My husband and i were both blown away at the amount of support and encouragement i received. Waking up from surgery, i could instantly feel relief throughout my body. I am 28 years old, and i haven’t felt this good since i was around 10 years old. I just kept thinking “my body is at peace now”. Less than 24 hours after surgery i was up and walking around, feeling great. At my post op appointment, I had another internal ultrasound; this time with ZERO pain. I couldn’t believe it, and everyone was so excited for me. Im seven weeks post op as i write this, and life has never been better. I am finally able to live my life pain free. My life has changed in more ways than I can explain. It’s hard to put into words the way that Dr. Seckin, Dr. Chu and their entire team changed my life. I look forward to being a volunteer through Dr. Seckins endometriosis foundation to help bring awareness to this horrific disease. To everyone who was a part of my journey- thank you for giving me my life back. I cannot recommend Dr. Seckin and Dr. Chu enough. If and when symptoms come back, I know exactly where to go, and i know there will be help waiting for me.

originalText.text: My experience with Dr. Seckin was 10/10. I have been trying to find an endo doctor for the past 2 years. He took his time reviewing my MRI and explaining to me what exactly is going on. Most doctors just rush you out and my consultation probably was close to 3 hours. I appreciate his diligence and patience. Will most likely be scheduling my surgery with him, as I have visited 3 other doctors. Nobody compares. If you want a doctor who genuinely just cares about you, definitely consider scheduling with Dr. Seckin.

originalText.text:
When I think of Dr. Seckin these are the words that come to mind. Gratitude, grateful, life-changing, a heart of gold. I feel compelled to give you a bit of background so you can understand the significance of this surgery for me.

I am passionate about Endometriosis because it has affected me most of my life and I have a strong desire to raise awareness and help others not to suffer.  Long story short I saw that Dr. Seckin's charity (EFA) was doing a patient awareness day in NYC in March 2018 and something told me I needed to be there. (I live in Detroit). I made a last minute decision to be there. After the full day of FREE education about Endo, I felt compelled to thank Dr. Seckin for putting this event on. I waited in a line up to thank him and I asked him if we could take a picture. He was curious about why I wanted a photo and asked me if I was press, but I told him no, I am just someone who has Endo and wanted to bring this education back to my little support group in MI. He asked me "how are you feeling?" I was honest with him, I said: "not so great." I told him that I had FIVE surgeries in the past and it has been about nine years since my last one, but I had begun to feel pretty sick again over the past few months. He said, "Come to see me", and my intuition told me, this is what I need to do, I instantly trusted him.  I was coming back to NYC in a few months for work and made an appointment.  We confirmed I still had Endo going on and we scheduled surgery for August.

I cannot say enough positive things about Dr. Seckin & his team. This decision changed my life. I have never met anyone like him. He is honest and to the point which I respect so very much.   I've never met a Doctor like him, I could feel his care, emotion and how badly he wants to help women with Endo.   I had planned and canceled a surgery last year with another "expert" who wanted me to have a Hysterectomy, said it "was time" since I was in pain again and I must have Adenomyosis. But guess what I do not have Adenomyosis and because of Dr. Seckin, I still have my Uterus.

I traveled from Detroit and it was the BEST decision of my life. I am overwhelmed with how well I was treated at the hospital and by Dr. Seckin and his team.  As you can tell I could go on forever about this, but the bottom line. Dr. Seckin is amazing, caring, compassionate and a life changer.  Sit in his office and watch all the hugs and love from his patients and you will know you are in the right hands to finally feel better and move on with your life.  Thank you, Dr. Seckin, for giving me a new life.

originalText.text: Dr. Seckin was able to provide diagnosis and solution while other doctors couldn't.  Dr. Seckin and Dr. Chu are amazing surgeons who take care to remember their patients personallly and provide amazing pre-op and post-op care
